features: ERGONOMIC DESIGN： Good surface coating technology given you a skin-like touch feeling. User-friendly design provide all-day comfort for work and entertainment, portable and pocket-sized perfect for travel, Mute design keeps away annoying clicks.

Use the DPI mouse button on the screen: you are free to adjust the mouse sensitivity to match your activity. Provide 3 DPI levels (800-1200-1600). The higher the DPI, the faster the cursor moves on the screen
For all computers and laptops and ios13 / ios14 tablet/pro/Air / Phone / MAC / MacBook / Pro / air windows / chromebook / HP / Dell
💡 7-color LED mouse: After the mouse is successfully connected to your computer/laptop/iPad device, the 7-color LED starts to light one by one.
BUILT-IN BATTERY: Built-in battery,easy to charge by micro usb cable,no more need for extra AAA battery.
body.description: How to use it:A. 2.4Ghz Mode:Switch to "ON/OFF" button to right.And Plug the receiver into the USB port of your computer, Then you can use the mouse in 2.4GHz Mode.B. Bluetooth Mode:Turn on the device's Bluetooth functionSwitch to "ON/OFF" button to left. (Bluetooth mode)Search the product of Bluetooth and find “BT5.1 Mouse” to pair. Then you can use the mouse in Bluetooth Mode.Note:System Requirement: iPadOS 13 or later, iOS 13 or later, Windows 8/ 10 or later, Mac OS X 10.10 or later, Android 5.0 or later.Package Included:1 x Wireless Mouse1 x USB Receiver (In the battery compartment of the mouse)1 x USB Charging Cable1 x User Manual1 x Type C AdapterNote:1. It's out of power if the mouse cursor moves slowly or stop moving. Please recharge it. Note: Please do not charge the mouse with mobile phone charger.2. Please charge the mouse for 2 hours before the first time to use it. The blue light beside the scroll wheel will be on while charging, and then goes off when the mouse is fully charged.3. Not all computers support two modes. For example, Win 7 system does not support Bluetooth mode,

reviews.reviewText: Works well . Love the colors and how it lights up. Very light and fits comfortably in the palm of your hand . Great purchase for the money . I’d buy it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Wife loves the lighted feature of this mouse and easy of use and setup. Works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like this mouse a lot. The fact that it is rechargeable is terrific -- makes the mouse lighter-weight, and eliminates the need to purchase batteries. It is easy to pair with the computer, and a full battery charge lasts longer than one full day. The wheel is very smooth-action, and the buttons are "easy-push." I would buy this mouse again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better with the 2.4G Adapter Included
reviews.reviewText: We recently bought a wireless mouse for our daughter, who is currently in graduate school. She had been voicing her frustration about the trackpad on her Mac, expressing a strong preference for a mouse similar to the one she uses on her desktop setup at home. After conducting some research, I came across this particular mouse. Its design appeared sleek and aerodynamic, the price was appealing, and it boasted compatibility with Mac. At a mere $11.88, it seemed like a no-brainer.Upon receiving the mouse, I was taken aback by its featherlight weight. In comparison to my Razer Death Adder Pro wireless mouse, it felt exceptionally light, almost to the point of feeling delicate. The mouse offered two connectivity options: Bluetooth and 2.4G with a USB receiver.The Bluetooth pairing process was hassle-free, with no complaints there. However, an issue I observed with the Bluetooth connection was that the mouse movement on the screen felt somewhat jerky, lacking the smoothness I was accustomed to. While I can't be certain if this was due to my familiarity with the Razer mouse, the jerkiness was definitely noticeable and somewhat annoying.I then switched to the 2.4G connection, and it was a game-changer. The added convenience of the included USB to USB-C adapter was a nice touch. Kudos for that. After plugging in the adapter and switching to 2.4G, the mouse's performance felt exceptionally smooth, free from jitter, lag, or jerkiness.Considering the price, I believe it's a worthwhile purchase. I admire its aesthetic, reminiscent of Apple's design sensibilities, and the ambient light feature is a definite plus. Particularly when used with the 2.4G adapter, it provides excellent value for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good enough mouse, but not as good as the original
reviews.reviewText: I got this mouse when the original mouse for my iMac stopped working properly. My first impression was how light it was, which makes sense because it doesn’t use batteries like my original mouse did. It can work with either bluetooth or wireless USB, so I first set it up for bluetooth use because I didn’t want to dedicate a USB port for it. It took a little while, but I did eventually get it to pair with my computer. Unfortunately, I was not able to change the settings for the mouse while it was in bluetooth connection mode, and the cursor moved way too fast for my preference. So I changed it to a wireless USB connection after which I was able to adjust the cursor movement to my taste.I have been using it for about a week now, and I would say it works decently, but not quite as well as my original mouse. It doesn’t have all the gestures that the Apple mouse has, where for example you can expand the view size by tapping, and you can scroll horizontally. But it does have a manual scroll wheel which is useful. It seems to go into “sleep” mode if you don’t use it for awhile in order to conserve the battery, and that means you have to click once to wake it up, which is slightly annoying. And I have noticed that the click isn’t quite as discreet and satisfying on this mouse, meaning that sometimes if I click too softly it feels like I have clicked, but nothing happens. On the other mouse, the difference between a click and a non-click was always very clear.In summary, this mouse isn’t as useful or high quality as my original mouse, but it is also much cheaper and it does get the job done. I’ll probably end up using it with a laptop when traveling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
